intro: Cryptantha torreyana var. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. It has slender, branching stems and small, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The flowers are clustered in racemes and are attractive to pollinators like bees and butterflies.
